title: Canoe

properties.name: description
properties.value: A canoe is a small boat that players can make to access faster transportation on the River Lum. Building canoes require the Woodcutting skill, and like other Woodcutting interactions, building the boat is faster with higher tier axes. At every canoe station there is an NPC to teach you how to make a canoe.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Canoe
A player canoeing along the River Lum.

A canoe is a small boat that players can make to access faster transportation on the River Lum. Building canoes require the Woodcutting skill, and like other Woodcutting interactions, building the boat is faster with higher tier axes. At every canoe station there is an NPC to teach you how to make a canoe.

Canoes will stay on a station if left until you log out. Making a canoe at another station will clear any previously left canoes while teleporting does not.

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Types of canoes
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 References

Locations[edit | edit source]

Select your destination.

There are 6 canoe stations along the River Lum; making a canoe requires that you have an axe (either wielded or in your inventory) for which you have the required Woodcutting level to use.

  • Lumbridge. Barfy Bill is at this canoe station.
  • Champions' Guild. Tarquin is at this canoe station.
  • Barbarian Village. Sigurd is at this canoe station.
  • Edgeville. Hari is at this canoe station.
  • Ferox Enclave. Marten is at this canoe station. Of the four types of canoe, only a waka canoe (Level 57 Woodcutting) can be rowed to it.
    • The Ferox Enclave canoe station can also be reached by entering the Ferox Enclave via walking (potentially dangerous due to the Ferox Enclave being surrounded by the Wilderness).
    • Instead of walking to the Ferox Enclave through the Wilderness, a safer option to reach the Ferox Enclave canoe station would be to use the minigames teleport (Clan Wars) that can be used once every 20 minutes.
    • Once in the Ferox Enclave, only an axe for which you have the woodcutting level to use (either wielded or in your inventory), a woodcutting level of 12, and the simplest level of canoe (log canoe) are required to row to Edgeville (one cannot row from the Ferox Enclave to the Wilderness Pond with a log canoe, dugout canoe, or stable dugout canoe, even though the Wilderness Pond is only one stop away on the River Lum from the Ferox Enclave).
  • Wilderness Pond, just south-east of the Lava Maze. Requires a waka canoe (Level 57 Woodcutting) to travel to. There is no canoe station there, so it is impossible to use a canoe to sail back down the river.

Types of canoes[edit | edit source]

4 different canoes.

Four different kinds of canoes can be made:

Image Canoe Woodcutting Notes
Level Exp
A Log 12 30 It will take you one stop along the River Lum. Cannot be used to travel to the Wilderness.
A Dugout 27 60 It can take you up to two stops along the River Lum. Cannot be used to travel to the Wilderness.
A Stable Dugout 42 90 It can take you up to three stops along the River Lum. Cannot be used to travel to the Wilderness.
A Waka 57 150 It can take you unlimited stops along the River Lum. The only canoe that can travel into the Wilderness.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 July 2020
(update)

Added another canoe station, located in Ferox Enclave.

24 September 2015
(update)

Canoes are now listed correctly as F2P content in the Woodcutting skillguide.

31 May 2013
(update | poll)

Canoes are now F2P features and can be used on worlds with F2P-style restrictions.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • "Waka" is the Māori word for canoe, or vessel. This word can by interpretation mean a spiritual vessel, or plain transportation. Waka were used in New Zealand predominately. Further, the Old School RuneScape sprite resembles a Waka tīwai or a river canoe.[1][2]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Māori Dictionary - entry: Wāka.*
  2. ↑ Wikipedia - Waka (canoe)
rawContent:
{{External|rs}}
[[File:Canoeing.gif|thumb|A player canoeing along the River Lum.]]
A '''canoe''' is a small boat that players can make to access faster [[transportation]] on the [[River Lum]]. Building canoes require the [[Woodcutting]] [[skill]], and like other [[Woodcutting]] interactions, building the boat is faster with higher tier axes. At every canoe station there is an [[NPC]] to teach you how to make a canoe.

Canoes will stay on a station if left until you log out. Making a canoe at another station will clear any previously left canoes while teleporting does not.

==Locations==
[[File:Locations for the canoes.png|thumb|Select your destination.]]
There are 6 canoe stations along the River Lum; making a canoe requires that you have an [[axe]] (either wielded or in your inventory) for which you have the required Woodcutting level to use.

*[[Lumbridge]]. [[Barfy Bill]] is at this canoe station.
*[[Champions' Guild]]. [[Tarquin]] is at this canoe station.
*[[Barbarian Village]]. [[Sigurd]] is at this canoe station.
*[[Edgeville]]. [[Hari]] is at this canoe station.
*[[Ferox Enclave]]. [[Marten]] is at this canoe station. Of the four types of canoe, only a waka canoe (Level 57 Woodcutting) can be rowed to it. 
**The Ferox Enclave canoe station can also be reached by entering the Ferox Enclave via walking (potentially '''dangerous''' due to the Ferox Enclave being surrounded by the Wilderness).
**Instead of walking to the Ferox Enclave through the Wilderness, a safer option to reach the Ferox Enclave canoe station would be to use the minigames teleport (Clan Wars) that can be used once every 20 minutes.
**Once in the Ferox Enclave, only an axe for which you have the woodcutting level to use (either wielded or in your inventory), a woodcutting level of 12, and the simplest level of canoe (log canoe) are required to row to Edgeville (one cannot row from the Ferox Enclave to the Wilderness Pond with a log canoe, dugout canoe, or stable dugout canoe, even though the Wilderness Pond is only one stop away on the River Lum from the Ferox Enclave).
*[[Wilderness]] Pond, just south-east of the [[Lava Maze]]. Requires a waka canoe (Level 57 Woodcutting) to travel to. '''There is no canoe station there''', so it is impossible to use a canoe to sail back down the river.

==Types of canoes==
[[File:Types of canoes.png|thumb|4 different canoes.]]
Four different kinds of canoes can be made:

Waka were used in New Zealand predominately.
